metadata.paragraph_text_preview: The Cosac Foundation, Inc. (Plaintiff), a non-profit charitable corporation dedicated to helping the...

target:
The Cosac Foundation, Inc. (Plaintiff), a non-profit charitable corporation dedicated to helping the homeless, brought this lawsuit on December 21, 2023 against Columbia County, Florida (defendant) in the U.S. District Court for the Middle District of Florida. The plaintiff challenged Columbia County Ordinance NO. 2022-03 (the ordinance), which prohibited solicitation and loitering within or upon any county building or the curtilage of those buildings. Specifically, the plaintiff claimed that the ordinance violated the First Amendment because it was an overbroad restriction on speech in traditional public fora. Additionally, the plaintiff claimed that the ordinance was unconstitutionally vague in violation of the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment. The plaintiff sought a declaration that the ordinance violated the First and Fourteenth Amendments, both facially and as-applied, a preliminary and permanent injunction against enforcement of the ordinance, all damages permitted by law, and attorneys’ fees and costs. The case was assigned to Judge Marcia Morales Howard.

On December 22, 2023, the plaintiffs filed a motion for a preliminary injunction. On January 24, 2024, the defendant filed a motion to dismiss. Two days later, the court granted in part and denied in part the plaintiff’s motion for a preliminary injunction. The court found that the plaintiff was substantially likely to succeed on the merits regarding both the First Amendment and the Fourteenth Amendment claims, and it enjoined the defendant from enforcing the ordinance. The court denied the plaintiff’s motion in any other respects.

On June 28, 2024, the plaintiff moved for summary judgment. After the defendant asked for an extension to file a response to the plaintiff’s motion, the defendant filed a notice of settlement on September 27, 2024. The parties subsequently filed a stipulation of dismissal, and the court dismissed the case with prejudice on October 24, 2024. The terms of the settlement were not made public. The case is now closed.

annotation.explanation: Plaintiffs: Individual, described as The Cosac Foundation, Inc., a non-profit charitable corporation dedicated to helping the homeless
Plaintiff: The Cosac Foundation, Inc., a non-profit charitable corporation dedicated to helping the homeless.
Defendant: Columbia County, Florida.
Parties and filing: Cosac Foundation (non-profit aiding the homeless) sued Columbia County, Florida on December 21, 2023 in the U.S. District Court for the Middle District of Florida.
Challenged law: Columbia County Ordinance No. 2022-03 prohibits solicitation and loitering within or upon any county building or the curtilage of those buildings.

Claims: The ordinance allegedly violates the First Amendment as an overbroad restriction on speech in traditional public fora and is unconstitutionally vague under the Fourteenth Amendment’s Due Process Clause.
Relief sought: Declaratory judgment (facial and as-applied), preliminary and permanent injunctions against enforcement, damages permitted by law, and attorneys’ fees and costs.
Judge: Marcia Morales Howard.
Complaint filed initiating the case on December 21, 2023 (M.D. Fla.).
